Escheat.origin: [Anglo-French eschete reversion of property, from Old French escheoite accession, inheritance, from feminine past participle of escheoir to fall (to), befall, ultimately from Latin ex- out + cadere to fall]

2.definition: the reversion of property to the state upon the death of the owner when there are no heirsvtto cause to revert by escheatto revert by escheat
